Structs/TGMapStyle.html#/s:10TallyGoKit1.name: normal

Protocols/TGSearchViewControllerDelegate.name: coordinateForSuggestions
Protocols/TGSearchViewControllerDelegate.abstract: Override the default implementation to provide the center coordinate to use for suggestions

Protocols/TGSearchViewControllerDelegate.name: coordinateForSearch
Protocols/TGSearchViewControllerDelegate.abstract: Override the default implementation to provide the center coordinate to use for searches

Protocols/TGSearchViewControllerDelegate.name: searchExtentForSuggest
Protocols/TGSearchViewControllerDelegate.abstract: Override the default implementation to provide the search Extent to use for suggestions

Protocols/TGSearchViewControllerDelegate.name: searchExtentForSearch
Protocols/TGSearchViewControllerDelegate.abstract: Override the default implementation to provide the search Extent to use for search

Protocols/TGSearchViewControllerDelegate.name: mapviewForSearch
Protocols/TGSearchViewControllerDelegate.abstract: This is required to determine useful search parameters

Protocols/TGSearchViewControllerDelegate.name: userWillSearch()
Protocols/TGSearchViewControllerDelegate.abstract: Override this function to be notified when the user begin interacting with the search text field. The default implementaion does nothing.

Protocols/TGSearchViewControllerDelegate.name: userDidSearch(searchResults:searchCategory:)
Protocols/TGSearchViewControllerDelegate.abstract: Override this function to handle the search results. This function is required to be implemented by the delegate.

Protocols/TGSearchViewControllerDelegate.name: cancelButtonPressed()
Protocols/TGSearchViewControllerDelegate.abstract: Override this function to be notified when the user presses the cancel button. The default implementaion does nothing.

Protocols/TGSearchResultsViewControllerD.name: TGSearchResultsViewControllerDelegate
Protocols/TGSearchResultsViewControllerD.abstract: Implement this protocol to be notified of user search results activity.

Protocols/TGSearchViewControllerDelegate.name: TGSearchViewControllerDelegate
Protocols/TGSearchViewControllerDelegate.abstract: Implement this protocol to be notified of user search activity and to provide locations and search extents for effective searching.

Global Variables.html#/s:10TallyGoKit0ab.name: TallyGoKitSimulatedCoordinateDidChangeNotification
Global Variables.html#/s:10TallyGoKit0ab.abstract: A notification posted when the user’s location has changed according to the driving simulator.

Global Variables.html#/s:10TallyGoKit47T.name: TGLocationManagerDidUpdateLocationsNotification
Global Variables.html#/s:10TallyGoKit47T.abstract: A notification posted when the user’s location has changed.

Global Variables.html#/s:10TallyGoKit37T.name: TGLocationManagerDidVisitNotification
Global Variables.html#/s:10TallyGoKit37T.abstract: A notification that is posted when the user vistit a location.

Global Variables.html#/s:10TallyGoKit52T.name: TGLocationManagerDidPauseLocationUpdatesNotification
Global Variables.html#/s:10TallyGoKit52T.abstract: A notification that is posted when the location manager is paused.

Global Variables.html#/s:10TallyGoKit53T.name: TGLocationManagerDidResumeLocationUpdatesNotification
Global Variables.html#/s:10TallyGoKit53T.abstract: A notification that is posted when the location manager resumes updates.

Global Variables.html#/s:10TallyGoKit36T.name: TGLocationManagerUserInfoLocationKey
Global Variables.html#/s:10TallyGoKit36T.abstract: A userInfo key used on location updates.

Global Variables.html#/s:10TallyGoKit33T.name: TGLocationManagerUserInfoVisitKey
Global Variables.html#/s:10TallyGoKit33T.abstract: A userInfo key used on location visits.

Global Variables.html#/s:10TallyGoKit41T.name: TGTelemetryCurrentPointChangeNotification
Global Variables.html#/s:10TallyGoKit41T.abstract: A notification that is posted when the user passes a point on a segment. The userInfo dictionary will contain values for the keys TGTelemetryUserInfoFromPointIndex and TGTelemetryUserInfoToPointIndex.

Global Variables.html#/s:10TallyGoKit37T.name: TGTelemetryNextTurnChangeNotification
Global Variables.html#/s:10TallyGoKit37T.abstract: A notification that is posted when the user passes a turn. The userInfo dictionary will contain a value for the key TGTelemetryUserInfoTurnPointIndex.

Global Variables.html#/s:10TallyGoKit40T.name: TGTelemetryProceedingToRouteNotification
Global Variables.html#/s:10TallyGoKit40T.abstract: A notification that is posted when the user is instructed to proceed to route.

Global Variables.html#/s:10TallyGoKit30T.name: TGTelemetryStartedNotification
Global Variables.html#/s:10TallyGoKit30T.abstract: A notification that is posted when user telemetry is started.

Global Variables.html#/s:10TallyGoKit31T.name: TGTelemetryOffRouteNotification
Global Variables.html#/s:10TallyGoKit31T.abstract: A notification that is posted when the user is determined to be off the route.

Global Variables.html#/s:10TallyGoKit32T.name: TGTelemetryReroutingNotification
Global Variables.html#/s:10TallyGoKit32T.abstract: A notification that is posted when the user is being rerouted.

Global Variables.html#/s:10TallyGoKit31T.name: TGTelemetryReroutedNotification
Global Variables.html#/s:10TallyGoKit31T.abstract: A notification that is posted when the user has been rerouted.

Global Variables.html#/s:10TallyGoKit32T.name: TGTelemetryCancelledNotification
Global Variables.html#/s:10TallyGoKit32T.abstract: A notification that is posted when the user cancels the route.

Global Variables.html#/s:10TallyGoKit32T.name: TGTelemetryConcludedNotification
Global Variables.html#/s:10TallyGoKit32T.abstract: A notification that is posted when the user concludes the route.

Global Variables.html#/s:10TallyGoKit34T.name: TGTelemetryInitializedNotification
Global Variables.html#/s:10TallyGoKit34T.abstract: A notification that is posted when user telemetry is initiated, but not yet started.

Global Variables.html#/s:10TallyGoKit33T.name: TGTelemetryUserInfoFromPointIndex
Global Variables.html#/s:10TallyGoKit33T.abstract: A userInfo key for the point change notifications and represents the point that was just passed.

Global Variables.html#/s:10TallyGoKit31T.name: TGTelemetryUserInfoToPointIndex
Global Variables.html#/s:10TallyGoKit31T.abstract: A userInfo key for the point change notifications and represents the upcoming point.

Global Variables.html#/s:10TallyGoKit33T.name: TGTelemetryUserInfoTurnPointIndex
Global Variables.html#/s:10TallyGoKit33T.abstract: A userInfo key for the turn change notifications and represents the point of the upcoming turn.

Classes/TGVoiceSynthesis.html#/s:10Tally.name: say(text:)

Classes/TGTurn/TGTurnDirection.html#/s:1.name: forward
Classes/TGTurn/TGTurnDirection.html#/s:1.abstract: No more than 8 degrees to the right or left.

Classes/TGTurn/TGTurnDirection.html#/s:1.name: exitleft
Classes/TGTurn/TGTurnDirection.html#/s:1.abstract: A highway off-ramp or interchange that is to the left of the carriageway.

Classes/TGTurn/TGTurnDirection.html#/s:1.name: exitright
Classes/TGTurn/TGTurnDirection.html#/s:1.abstract: A highway off-ramp or interchange that is to the right of the carriageway.

Classes/TGTurn/TGTurnDirection.html#/s:1.name: leftatthefork
Classes/TGTurn/TGTurnDirection.html#/s:1.abstract: Two streets are within a forwardmost 60 degree arc. Take the leftmost street.

Classes/TGTurn/TGTurnDirection.html#/s:1.name: rightatthefork
Classes/TGTurn/TGTurnDirection.html#/s:1.abstract: Two streets are within a forwardmost 60 degree arc. Take the rightmost street.

Classes/TGTurn/TGTurnDirection.html#/s:1.name: uturn
Classes/TGTurn/TGTurnDirection.html#/s:1.abstract: Turn 180 degrees to return the way you came (on the other side of a dual carriageway).

Classes/TGTurn/TGTurnDirection.html#/s:1.name: uturnleft
Classes/TGTurn/TGTurnDirection.html#/s:1.abstract: Turn 180 degrees to return the way you came (on the other side of a dual carriageway).

Classes/TGTurn/TGTurnDirection.html#/s:1.name: uturnright
Classes/TGTurn/TGTurnDirection.html#/s:1.abstract: Turn 180 degrees to the right to return the way you came (on the other side of a dual carriageway).

Classes/TGTurn/TGTurnDirection.html#/s:1.name: mergeleft
Classes/TGTurn/TGTurnDirection.html#/s:1.abstract: A merge into traffic to the left.

Classes/TGTurn/TGTurnDirection.html#/s:1.name: mergeright

Classes/TGSuggestRequest.html#/s:10Tally.name: text

Classes/TGSuggestion.html#/s:10TallyGoKi.name: price
Classes/TGSuggestion.html#/s:10TallyGoKi.abstract: An object containing the price tier from 1 (least pricey) - 4 (most pricey) and a message describing the price tier.

Classes/TGSearchRequest.html#/s:10TallyG.abstract: Value obtained from prior request to suggest API, used to get the location of a specific suggestion.

Classes/TGRouteRequest/TGRouteRequestTyp.name: ArrivalTime
Classes/TGRouteRequest/TGRouteRequestTyp.abstract: The time specified is the desired arrival time.

Classes/TGRouteRequest/TGRouteRequestTyp.name: DepartureTime
Classes/TGRouteRequest/TGRouteRequestTyp.abstract: The time specified is the desired departure time.

Classes/TGRouteRequest/TGRouteRequestTyp.name: TGRouteRequestType
Classes/TGRouteRequest/TGRouteRequestTyp.abstract: The request type defines the time parameter as either the desired arrival time or the departure time.

Classes/TGRouteRequest.html#/s:10TallyGo.name: coords
Classes/TGRouteRequest.html#/s:10TallyGo.abstract: Array of corrdinates. First coordinate is the start, last coordinate is the end, coordinates in between are waypoints.

Classes/TGRouteRequest.html#/s:10TallyGo.name: requestType
Classes/TGRouteRequest.html#/s:10TallyGo.abstract: The type of request, either arrival or departure time request.

Classes/TGRouteRequest.html#/s:10TallyGo.name: speed
Classes/TGRouteRequest.html#/s:10TallyGo.abstract: The current speed of the user. This is used by the routing engine to prevent situations where the driver is told to turn sooner than would be possible at the start of their route.

Classes/TGRouteRequest.html#/s:10TallyGo.name: course
Classes/TGRouteRequest.html#/s:10TallyGo.abstract: The current course of the user. This is used by the routing engine to determine the starting direction of the route.

Classes/TGRouteRequest.html#/s:10TallyGo.name: existingTripId
Classes/TGRouteRequest.html#/s:10TallyGo.abstract: Optional. For reroutes you may pass in an existing Trip ID to be used on the first returned segment.

Classes/TGRoute.html#/s:10TallyGoKit7TGR.name: totalDuration

Classes/TGAddress.html#/s:10TallyGoKit9T.abstract: Contains the first 5 digits of the U.S. Zip Code

Classes/TGAddress.html#/s:10TallyGoKit9T.name: locationName
Classes/TGAddress.html#/s:10TallyGoKit9T.abstract: The type of address found. Contents varies.

Classes/TGAddress.html#/s:10TallyGoKit9T.name: placeName
Classes/TGAddress.html#/s:10TallyGoKit9T.abstract: The name of place found. Contents varies.

Classes/TGAddress.html#/s:10TallyGoKit9T.name: address
Classes/TGAddress.html#/s:10TallyGoKit9T.abstract: The street address portion of the result.

Classes/TGAddress.html#/s:10TallyGoKit9T.name: postalExtension
Classes/TGAddress.html#/s:10TallyGoKit9T.abstract: The last 4 digits of a 9-digit U.S. Zip Code.

Classes/TGAddress.html#/s:10TallyGoKit9T.name: subregion
Classes/TGAddress.html#/s:10TallyGoKit9T.abstract: The subregion. Not normally used for U.S. locations.

Classes/TallyGoStyleKit/ResizingBehavior.name: aspectFill
Classes/TallyGoStyleKit/ResizingBehavior.abstract: The content is proportionally resized to fit into the target rectangle.

Classes/TallyGoStyleKit/ResizingBehavior.name: stretch
Classes/TallyGoStyleKit/ResizingBehavior.abstract: The content is proportionally resized to completely fill the target rectangle.

Classes/TallyGoStyleKit/ResizingBehavior.name: center
Classes/TallyGoStyleKit/ResizingBehavior.abstract: The content is stretched to match the entire target rectangle.

Classes/TallyGoStyleKit/ResizingBehavior.name: apply(rect:target:)
Classes/TallyGoStyleKit/ResizingBehavior.abstract: The content is centered in the target rectangle, but it is NOT resized.

Classes/TallyGoKit.html#/s:10TallyGoKitA.name: accessToken
Classes/TallyGoKit.html#/s:10TallyGoKitA.abstract: The access token that will be used for authorization to certain functions.

Classes/TallyGoKit.html#/s:10TallyGoKitA.name: showsTraffic
Classes/TallyGoKit.html#/s:10TallyGoKitA.abstract: Show colored traffic lines as an overlay on the map

Classes/TallyGoKit.html#/s:10TallyGoKitA.name: currentSegment
Classes/TallyGoKit.html#/s:10TallyGoKitA.abstract: This return the current segment being routed by TGGuidanceViewController.

Classes/TallyGoKit.html#/s:10TallyGoKitA.name: initialize(withAccessToken:simulatedCoordinate:configurationOverrideName:)
Classes/TallyGoKit.html#/s:10TallyGoKitA.abstract: Initialize the service, sets the access token required for some API calls, and optionally set the starting location for the driving simulator. Starts the location manager to begin generating location updates.

Classes/TallyGoKit.html#/s:10TallyGoKitA.name: currentLocation
Classes/TallyGoKit.html#/s:10TallyGoKitA.abstract: The most recent location reported by the location manager

Classes/TallyGoKit.html#/s:10TallyGoKitA.name: simulatedCoordinate
Classes/TallyGoKit.html#/s:10TallyGoKitA.abstract: Sets the starting location for the driving simulator. Set to nil to disable simulated locations.

Classes/TallyGoKit.html#/s:10TallyGoKitA.name: simulatedHighwaySpeed
Classes/TallyGoKit.html#/s:10TallyGoKitA.abstract: Sets the simulated driving speed on highways

Classes/TallyGoKit.html#/s:10TallyGoKitA.name: simulatedCitySpeed
Classes/TallyGoKit.html#/s:10TallyGoKitA.abstract: Sets the simulated driving speed on city streets

Classes/TallyGoKit.html#/s:10TallyGoKitA.name: createMapView()
Classes/TallyGoKit.html#/s:10TallyGoKitA.abstract: Returns a new instance of MGLMapView using the TallyGo map style. If the driving simulator is on, the map view will use it instead of the location manager.

Classes/TGBaseObject.html.name: TGBaseObject
Classes/TGBaseObject.html.abstract: The base class for all data model classes.

Classes/TGBaseRequest.html.name: TGBaseRequest
Classes/TGBaseRequest.html.abstract: The base class for all request classes.

Classes/TGBaseResponse.html.name: TGBaseResponse
Classes/TGBaseResponse.html.abstract: The base class for all response classes.

Classes.html#/s:10TallyGoKit13TGBaseServ.name: TGBaseService
Classes.html#/s:10TallyGoKit13TGBaseServ.abstract: The base class for all service classes.

Classes.html#/s:10TallyGoKit17TGBoundary.name: TGBoundaryRequest
Classes.html#/s:10TallyGoKit17TGBoundary.abstract: A request to get the area coverered by the navigation service.

Classes/TGBoundaryResponse.html.name: TGBoundaryResponse
Classes/TGBoundaryResponse.html.abstract: The response that contains the boundary of the covered navigational area.

Classes/TGConfiguration.html.name: TGConfiguration
Classes/TGConfiguration.html.abstract: Retrieves remote configuration information for the internal operation of the SDK.

Classes/TGConfigurationResponse.html.name: TGConfigurationResponse
Classes/TGConfigurationResponse.html.abstract: Response object from get configuration API call.

Classes/TGEventService.html.name: TGEventService
Classes/TGEventService.html.abstract: Provides an interface to TallyGo’s events API providing accident and road hazard information.

Classes/TGFind.html.name: TGFind
Classes/TGFind.html.abstract: Provides access to the TallyGo Find service for street address and point-of-interest searching, as well as reverse geocoding.

Classes/TGGeoJSONPoint.html.name: TGGeoJSONPoint
Classes/TGGeoJSONPoint.html.abstract: A GeoJSON object that represents a single point.

Classes/TGGuidanceViewController.html.name: TGGuidanceViewController
Classes/TGGuidanceViewController.html.abstract: View controller with TallyGo navigation and Mapbox mapview

Classes/TGIdleTimer.html.name: TGIdleTimer
Classes/TGIdleTimer.html.abstract: A class that facilitiates disabling the device’s idle timer.

Classes/TGNavigation.html.name: TGNavigation
Classes/TGNavigation.html.abstract: Provides an interface to TallyGo’s navigation API.

Classes/TGPoint.html.name: TGPoint
Classes/TGPoint.html.abstract: TGPoint represents a specific location along the route, and may also contain data important at that location.

Classes/TGReverseGeocodeResponse.html.name: TGReverseGeocodeResponse
Classes/TGReverseGeocodeResponse.html.abstract: Response object from the reverse geocode function.

Classes/TGRoute.html.name: TGRoute
Classes/TGRoute.html.abstract: TGRoute represents a drivable route between points in the road network. A route consists of one or more segments, which in turn consist of a collection of points on the road network.

Classes/TGRouteRequest.html.name: TGRouteRequest
Classes/TGRouteRequest.html.abstract: Request for turn by turn navigation with multiple waypoints.

Classes/TGSearchRequest.html.name: TGSearchRequest
Classes/TGSearchRequest.html.abstract: Defines parameters for a location search performed with TGFind.search()

Classes/TGSearchViewController.html.name: TGSearchViewController
Classes/TGSearchViewController.html.abstract: View controller that allows the user to find locations by entering text searches. This feature is currently in beta and the implementation may change.

Classes/TGSegment.html.name: TGSegment
Classes/TGSegment.html.abstract: TGSegment represets one segment of a route. A route from location A to B will consist of only one segment. Introducing a stop along the way will result in two segments, from A to B, and B to C. Similar to routes, each segment has its own distance, and estimated travel time.

Classes/TGStyledMapView.html.name: TGStyledMapView
Classes/TGStyledMapView.html.abstract: A subclass of MGLMapView that uses the TallyGo map style and updates traffic lines.

Classes/TGSuggestRequest.html.name: TGSuggestRequest
Classes/TGSuggestRequest.html.abstract: Request for a list of suggested autocompletion location items.

Classes/TGTurn.html.name: TGTurn
Classes/TGTurn.html.abstract: TGTurn represents a turn at a specific point in the route.

Classes/TGVoiceSynthesis.html.name: TGVoiceSynthesis
Classes/TGVoiceSynthesis.html.abstract: Service to speak and preload voice prompts.

Global Variables.html.name: Global Variables
Global Variables.html.abstract: The following global variables are available globally.
